stable.title: RAPIDS Kepler.gl PoC v2
stable.description: Proof of Concept - Extend kepler.gl functionality to very large datasets on GPU memory, without browser limitations.

stable.title: Customizable output types
stable.description: New framework for cuML estimators to return user-specified output types (e.g. numpy outputs to match scikit-learn style or GPU array outputs for maximal performance.)

stable.title: MNMG Naive Bayes
stable.description: Naive Bayes classifiers, supporting multi-node, multi-gpu scaling

stable.title: Seasonal ARIMA
stable.description: Support for seasonality in Auto Regressive Moving Average time series models.

stable.title: MNMG Linear/Ridge/Lasso regression
stable.description: Multi-node, multi-GPU support for popular linear models, including OLS, Ridge, and Lasso regression.

stable.title: Decimal fixed point (initial 64-bit type design)
stable.description: Define new fixed-point data type and columns & port algorithms to operate on them.

stable.title: Dictionary columns (initial design)
stable.description: Define new dictionary (aka categorical) column type & port algorithms to operate on them.

stable.title: Finish libcudf++ refactor
stable.description: Refactor all of libcudf to use new base column/table types

nightly.title: ForceAtlas2
nightly.description:
Used by visualization tool and it define the (x,y) screen coordinates to place items
Hugo (intern) is working this and we are seeing a 3x speed-up over state-of-the-art

nightly.title: Remove legacy code
nightly.description: Finishing up the libcudf API refactor we internally call "libcudf++" and dropping all legacy APIs that were previously deprecated.

nightly.title: Documentation C++/Python
nightly.description: Improving C++ and Python API and usage documentation.

nightly.title: Bug Squashing
nightly.description: The RAPIDS team is spending significant time during the 0.14 release cycle on eliminating known bugs and paying down technical debt.

future.title: Read / write partitioned Parquet directories
future.description: Support reading and writing partitioned Parquet datasets efficiently via cuDF.

future.title: Read vector of ORC/Parquet files into single table
future.description: It's common to need to process a large number of small parquet or ORC files generated from somewhere else, where a single file isn't capable of saturating a GPU effectively. We should allow passing a vector of files into a single `read_parquet` or `read_orc` call to expose more parallelism to the GPU to more effectively use it.

future.description: public description goes here

future.description: public description goes here

future.title: Multi-class forest inference
future.description: public description goes here

future.title: MNMG DBSCAN (v1)
future.description: public description goes here

future.title: MNMG UMAP (Parallel transform, serial fit)
future.description: Simplified support for transforming a large dataset via UMAP. Fitting occurs on the data for one GPU, but transform can support many GPUs in parallel.

future.title: MG Renumbering
future.description: public description goes here

future.title: MG WCC
future.description: public description goes here

future.title: MG BFS
future.description: public description goes here

future.title: Inequality Joins
future.description: Support joins where the join condition is an inequality.

future.title: Expanded groupby aggregations
future.description: Expand and complete the set of supported aggregations for groupby.

future.title: Decimal fixed point column type
future.description: Adding support for columns of 64-bit fixed-point decimal values, and support for these in cuDF algorithms.

future.title: Dictionary columns (broad integration)
future.description: Integrating Dictionary columns into cuDF algorithms.

future.title: Nested type columns (lists)
future.description: Add support for a `List` datatype which allows for each element in a column to be a vector of another type of elements.

future.title: UCX-Py v2
future.description:
- Split UCX-Py into two packages: https://github.com/rapidsai/ucx-py/issues/429
- Upstream UCX-Py to OpenUCX
- More MNMG testings

future.title: Hungarian Algorithm
future.description: The Hungarian method is a combinatorial optimization algorithm that solves the assignment problem in polynomial time and which anticipated later primal-dual methods.

future.title: Subgraph Matching (Gunrock)
future.description: public description goes here

future.title: Leiden Algorithm
future.description: Variation of the Louvain algorithm that addresses many of the issues found in Louvain.

future.title: MNMG PageRank
future.description: Implement the PageRank algorithm to run across multiple nodes.   V1 will create a OPG version of the analytic, then benchmark and tune it

future.title: MNMG Logistic Regression
future.description: Dask-ML enhancements and examples to allow GPU-accelerated multi-node, multi-GPU logistic regression.

future.title: Kafka Data Source
future.description: Support Kafka as a data source for reading data into cuDF.

future.title: GPUDirect Storage optimization v1
future.description: Initial optimization work in utilizing GPUDirect Storage in cuIO parquet and ORC readers
